oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Willie Nelson interview part 2 - Biff Collie Inside Nashville
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part two of a recording of an interview with Willie Nelson (performer), conducted by Biff Collie (host) for his radio program Inside Nashville.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Willie Nelson says how his first success was the first time he made money doing what he loved to do -- Nelson talks about how he wrote poems when he was 5 years old and starting writing and playing when he was 6 -- Nelson talks about The Storm Within My Heart being the first song of his that got recorded -- Nelson talks about all the places he's lived throughout his career -- Nelson talks about the first time he sold some of his songs -- Nelson says the first place he went to in Nashville was Tootsie's Orchid Lounge and walking in on a jam session and meeting Hank Cochran -- Nelson talks about starting out in Nashville and how he got songs approved early on -- Nelson talks about being accepted early on as a songwriter -- Nelson talks about slowing down on songwriting -- Nelson talks about still recording in Nashville sometimes -- Nelson talks about playing clubs every night and how his unique phrasing in singing came about -- Nelson talks about leaving Nashville for Texas because of work demands -- Nelson talks about working in Texas -- Nelson talks about Ray Charles being the most important figure in the history of country music -- Nelson talks about country coming from the bluegrass -- Nelson talks about the Outlaw Country movement -- Nelson talks about playing the Armadillo Club -- Nelson talks about growing his hair and beard out because to be accepted by the young people and to irritate the people who didn't like it -- Nelson talks about why he hasn't done much television work, but he is doing some -- Nelson talks about being on Johnny Carson's show -- Nelson talks about doing a duet album with Waylon Jennings -- Nelson talks about his acting career and working with Robert Redford -- Nelson talks about acting in the Electric Horseman, Honeysuckle Rose and The Thief -- Nelson talks about doing nothing to prepare for his acting career -- Nelson talks about the movie business in comparison to the music business -- Nelson talks about spending time with Candice Burgin and Jane Fonda -- Nelson talks about being unbothered by the media -- Nelson talks about enjoying big crowds and that Kris Kristofferson is the opposite -- Nelson says that he does not really know if he is a sex symbol or not -- Nelson talks about being treated very well by his female audience -- Nelson talks about acting being easy -- Nelson says Angel Flying Too Close To The Ground being his favorite song of his -- Nelson says in regards to songwriting, he utilizes multiple methods, but the best is when he is presented with a challenge -- Nelson talks about writing On The Road Again in 10 minutes -- Nelson talks about some of his favorite other songs -- Nelson talks about Blue Eyes Crying In The Rain and the impact it had on the world -- Nelson talks about playing on the Grand Ole Opry and that he left because of a rule that required him to be there more time than he could -- Nelson says that his least favorite thing about touring is security, who he wish would leave him alone (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Collie, Biff; Nelson, Willie; Nelson, Willie, 1933-;
